channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Curb sweeping, 10th September
item.description:
Can the curb be swept, a build up of debris is accumulating. I see litter picking out no sweeping. Increasing council tax I hope the streets are being properly cleaned
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Give Way road marking barely visible, 10th September
item.description:
Hi, the give way sign in Riverdale Road (DA5 1QX) at the junction with Upton Road South is barely visible. The cara coming out of Riverdale and turning into Upton Road South often come out of Riverdale Road at speed, not paying attention to cars coming down from the left (top of Upton Road South). There have been multiple occasions where I’d drive down from Upton Road South only to be met with cars coming out from Riverdale Road without giving any regards to the fact they need to give way. I have had to break sharply, putting myself and my children at a risk of collision with drivers not respecting the ‘give way’ requirement. This morning I was verbally abused by someone who had nearly driven into the side of my car (I was driving slowly down Upton Road South and they turned out of Riverdale without stopping). When I calmly pointed out the gentleman should have given way to the oncoming vehicle (mine), he called me multiple names and told me ‘how the f am I supposed to know the sign is not there’ when I pointed it out he said ‘it’s barely visible, may as well not be there, you need to learn how to drive’. I had a small child in the car with me and it was awful. The ‘give way’ road marking needs to be repainted and potentially an additional, actual Give Way sign on a pole added to the junction. This is a serious accident waiting to happen.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Riverdale Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin and wooden post obstructing, 10th September

item.title: Forest hill: waste not in bins, 10th September
item.description:
There is a recent and live spate of piles of rubbish bags on Dartmouth and London road in forest hill. Often this results in untidiness and litter (commercial or residential) being strewn across the streets. Is this allowed by policy? Should Lewisham be enforcing the use of bins? Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Dartmouth Road, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish building up on street, 10th September
item.description:
I have reported this already. Been a problem for many years. Hackney council assured they would clean daily and jet wash. This is not happening. Please clean - there are rats. Please raise this with appropriate enforcement team.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pembury Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
